item.title: Manage your Projects using the GitHub Project Board
item.description: Overview Projects boards on GitHub help you organize and prioritize your work using the Scrum framework for project management. The benefit from project boards is that you can link your repositories. This way all issues that are related to different projects can be organized in a unique project board. item.title: How to Prepare for (and Follow-up On) Scrum Meetings
item.description: How to Prepare for (and Follow-up on) Scrum Meetings When using Scrum and GitHub Project Boards to manage work on projects, it’s tempting to forget actually preparing and following-up on meetings. Sol here are our tips to make meetings as effective as possible. Prepare the meeting Ensure that all the issues that are completed are moved to the “Done” section. If you have a follow-up question/tasks on an issue you have moved to “Done”, make sure to add a comment to that issue.

item.title: Write GitHub Issues That Get the Job Done
item.description: Overview Why Issues? Github Issues can be used to clearly define tasks that either you or your team members will eventually work on. In combination with Kanban-style GitHub Project boards, they become a compelling way of coordinating teamwork.
